intro: Schiedeella valerioi, commonly known as the slender schiedea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments, often in montane rainforests. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Schiedeella valerioi is considered endangered due to habitat loss and introduced species, making it a subject of conservation interest.
